metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5788 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow that leads to a use-after-free in Blink Storage in Google Chrome on Linux prior to 73.0.3683.75 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
